column4: hey, I'm still stuck with modprobe:  FATAL: Error inserting lirc_serial (/lib/modules/2.6.22-14-generic/ubuntu/media/lirc/lirc_serial/lirc_serial.ko): Device or resource busy
That is what I ran it with
ok, try doing that without the ir inserted
thanks for trying, but that didn't work either :(
I've also stopped lircd and removed the other lirc modules in case they were conflicting

hmm... that is an odd error, device busy tends to mean that it can't remove, the fact that it cant modprobe, glance at dmesg, does it have another module confilicting perhaps? just dmesg | tail to see the last few lines
you were to quick for me =)
sorry [ 1544.766432] lirc_serial: port 02f8 already in use
I don't know what port 02f8 is, is there any way I can find out what's using it?
sounds like an irq conflict to me, is the bios seutp to do it manually?
the only other serial device I can think of the mouse
no, it doesn't but I think I'll check that  again
right, but lots of things get irqs, every device in fact, although unless you have made all the devices manual irq, that soundn't happen...
I don't believe I did, I'm pretty darn sure
i may be pulling on threads here, but that does sound like a conflict...
